verses.verse: (1 He prayeth for the prosperous estate of the kingdom of Solomon, who was the figure of Christ,4 under whom shall be righteousness, peace, and felicity.10 Unto whom all Kings and nations shall do homage,17 Whose name and power shall endure forever, and in whom all nations shall be blessed. Give thy (Endue the king with the Spirit of wisdom and justice, that he reign not as do the worldly tyrants.) judgments to the King, O God, and thy righteousness to the King’s (To wit, to his posterity.) son.
Then shall he judge thy people in righteousness, and thy poor with equity.
The (When justice reigneth, even the places most barren shall be enriched with thy blessings.) mountains, and the hills shall bring peace to the people by justice.

He shall (He showeth wherefore the sword is committed to Kings: to wit, to defend the innocent, and suppress the wicked.) judge the poor of the people: he shall save the children of the needy, and shall subdue the oppressor.
They shall (The people shall embrace thy true religion, when thou givest a King that ruleth according to thy word.) fear thee as long as the sun and moon endureth, from generation to generation.

He shall come (As this is true in all godly kings, so it is chiefly verified in Christ, who with his heavenly dew, maketh his Church ever to flourish.) down like the rain upon the mown grass, and as the showers that water the earth.
In his days shall the righteous flourish, and abundance of peace shall be so long as the moon endureth.

His dominion shall be also from (That is, from the red sea to the sea called Syriacum, and from Euphrates forward, meaning, that Christ’s Kingdom should be large and universal.) sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the land.
They that dwell in the wilderness, shall kneel before him, and his enemies shall lick the dust.

The kings of (Of Cilicia, and of all other countries, beyond the sea, which he meaneth by the isles.) Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings (That is, of Arabia that rich country, whereof Sheba was a part bordering upon Ethiopia.) of Sheba and Seba shall bring gifts.
Yea, all kings shall worship him: all nations shall serve him.
For he shall deliver the poor when he crieth: the needy also, and him that hath no helper.
He shall be merciful to the poor and needy, and shall preserve the souls of the poor.

He shall redeem their souls from deceit and violence, and (Though tyrants pass not to shed blood, yet this godly king shall preserve his subjects from all kind of wrong.) dear shall their blood be in his sight.

Yea, he shall live, and unto him shall they give of the (God will both prosper his life, and also make the people most willing to obey him.) gold of Sheba: they shall also pray for him continually, and daily bless him.

An handful of corn shall be sown in the earth, even in the top of the mountains, and the (Under such a king shall be most great plenty, both of fruit and also of the increase of mankind.) fruit thereof shalt shake like the trees of Lebanon: and the children shall flourish out of the city like the grass of the earth.

His name shall be forever: his name shall endure as long as the Sun: all nations shall bless (They shall pray to God for his continuance, and know that God doth prosper them for his sake.) him, and be blessed in him.
Blessed be the Lord God, even the God of Israel which only doeth (He confesseth that except God miraculously preserve his people, that neither the king nor the kingdom can continue.) wondrous things.
And blessed be his glorious Name forever: and let all the earth be filled with his glory. So be it, even so be it.
[20] Here end the (Concerning his son Solomon.) prayers of David the son of Jesse.
